intro: Clerodendrum linnaei, commonly known as the white clerodendrum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking white or pale pink tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers are usually clustered in inflorescences and bloom during the summer months.
